intro: Quercus castanea var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptical chestnut oak, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical-shaped leaves that are dark green on top and lighter on the underside. The tree produces small, spiny acorns that are typically enclosed in a cupule. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mixed hardwood forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and forest biodiversity.
